From: J.D. Oder II
Sent: Wednesday, August 16, 2017 4:35 PM
To: Sam Shrefler; Taylor Oder; Justin Dillich; Randy Miskanic; Patrick Oder
Cc: Jeffrey Shavitz
Subject: Shift4

Guys,
   As you know, we are in the process of potentially losing Shift 4. At this stage it looks like them leaving is
imminent. At present they use the following services:
   •   Merchant services for 8,000+ locations
 
   •   Datacap Gift Cards for 2,000+ locations

   •    Our gateway for 700+ locations.

I received an email. from Shift4 this rmnming. saying they, will be, leaving,, at the ,end of, their term, which, is, ,at, the end, of
February 2018. As mentioned many times, I do not see any scenario that exists where Shift4 remains our partner for
merchant services and I have very little hope for our gateway business to remain either. This leaves our Datacap gift
card program.
Shift4 has been quietly and confidentially "dumping" their gift card business for well over a year now. They have added
very few new gift card merchants and have let attrition take its course. We currently have a very small piece of their
overall gift card volume. At present we are integrated to Datacap's GIFTePay product.

**Action Items**

1.  First and foremost, everyone needs to remain calm and keep this information between us. The last thing we need
is Shift4 finding out that we openly know that they are leaving us. We need to buy time, and appear to still be
playing ball, as though we plan on them remaining our customer, regardless of how far from the truth that rnay
be.
2. Gift Cards- We need to devise a go forward communication plan that we can present face to face when visiting
Shift4 September 5-6, 2017.
 a. Who is our contact?
 b. How will we get time with them?
 c. Do we know what their strategy is?
 d. If yes, how can we capitalize on it and/or make changes to it?
 e. If no, what do we propose?

Shift4 did the majority of the technical lifting to use GIFTePay; however, the lion's share of ongoing
support for the merchants sits on our support team.

```
From: J.D. Oder II
Sent: Wednesday, August 16, 2017 4:35 PM
To: Sam Shrefler; Taylor Oder ; Justin Dillich; Randy Miskanic; Patrick Oder
Cc: Jeffrey Shavitz
Subject: Shift4

Guys,

As you know, we are in the process of potentially losing Shift4. _At this stage it looks like then1 leaving is
imminent_. At present they use the following services:

• Merchant services for 8,000+ locations

• Datacap Gift Cards for 2,000+ locations

• Our gateway for 700+ locations.

I received an email from Shift4 this morning. saying they will be leaving at the end of their tern1, which is the end of
February 2018. As mentioned many times, I do not see any scenario that exists where Shift4 remains our partner for
merchant services and I have very little hope for our gateway business to remain either. This leaves our Datacap gift
card program.

Shift4 has been quietly and confidentially "dumping" their gift card business for well over a year now. They have added
very few new gift card merchants and have let attrition take its course. We currently have a very small piece of their
overall gift card volume. At present we are integrated to Datacap's GIFTePay product.

Action Items :
1. First and foremost, everyone needs to remain calm and keep this information between us. The last thing we need
is Shift4 linding out that we openly know that they are leaving us. We need to buy time, and appear to still be
playing ball, as though we plan on then1 remaining our customer, regardless of how far from the truth that may
be.

```

```
2. Gift Cards- We need to devise a go forward communication plan that we can present face to face when visiting
Shift4 September 5-6, 2017.
 a. Who is our contact"
 b. How will we get time with them?
 c. Do we know what their strategy is,·
 d. If yes, how can we capitalize on it and/or make changes to it?
 e. If no, what do we propose?

Shift 4 did the majority of the technical lifting to use GIFTePay; however, the lion's share of ongoing
support for the merchants sits on our support team.

```

From: Sam Shrefler
Sent: Monday, August 28, 2017 4:38 PM

Cc: J.D, Oder II; Randy Miskanic; Patrick Oder; Taylor Oder

Subject: Gift Cards
Importance: High
Per my voice mail, attached is information for the Shift4 gift card program.

Background:
•	 Shift4 used our legacy gift card platform and experienced significant growth in gift cards from 2009-2015.
•	 They made a business decision in early-2016 to stop selling gift cards. This has resulted in almost a 12% decline in their gift card revenue,
•	 As discussed a few weeks back, Shift4 is leaving CardConnect as their merchant account provider, and they likely are taking the gateway business in-house too
•	 J.D., my Dad, and 1 are meeting.with Shift4 in Vegas next week, primarily to present our case for still handling all or their gift processing ,

Attached:
I , Current stats for Shift4's gift card program,
2, A letter that we are planning to send out on behalfofShift4 to encourage participation in the, program.
3, A DRAFT proposal for a new program.
a; It is, important to know; that we currently do NOT have an agreement with Datacap (the people,whoprovide the Gift Cards) and have not received any firm pricing,
b, I believe we have two options:

From: J.D. Oder II
Sent: Wednesday, August 16, 2017 4:35 PM
To: Sam Shrefler; Taylor Oder; Justin Dillich; Randy Miskanic; Patrick Oder
Cc: Jeffrey Shavitz
Subject: Shift4
Guys,
As you know, we are in the process of potentially losing Shift4. At this stage it looks like them leaving is imminent. At present they use the following services:
•	 Merchant services for 8,000-!- locations
•	 Datacap Gift Cards for 2,000+ locations
•	 Our gateway for 700+ locations.
I received an email from Shift4 this morning saying they will be leaving at the end of their term, which is at the end of February 2018. As mentioned many times, I do not see any scenario that exists where Shift4 remains our partner for merchant services and I have very little hope for our gateway business to remain either. This leaves our Datacap gift card program.

Shift4 has been quietly and confidentially "dumping" their gift card business for well over a year now. They have added very few new gift card merchants and have let attrition take its course. We currently have a very small piece of their overall gift card volume. At present we are integrated to Datacap's GIFTePay product.

Action Items
1.	 First and foremost, everyone needs to remain calm and keep this information between us. The last thing we need is Shift4 finding out that we openly know that they are leaving us. We need to buy time, and appear to still be playing ball, as though we plan on them remaining our customer, regardless of how far from the truth that may be.
2.	 Gift Cards- We need to devise a go forward communication plan that we can present face to face when visiting Shift4 September 5-6, 2017.
a.	 Who is our contact?
b.	 How will we get time with them?
c.	 Do we know what their strategy is?
d.	 If yes, how can we capitalize on it and/or make changes to it?
e.	 If no, what do we propose?
